Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's son's health condition constitutes an excessive demand on Canadian health services
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.38(1)(c)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant's son has congenital heart disease; immigration officer relied on Dr. Hindle's narrative contradicting treating cardiologist Dr. Belli's reports
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Initial refusal based on potential excessive demand
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Decision found unreasonable and set aside
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking permanent residency with dependent child
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer failed to consider financial assurances and relied on incomplete medical analysis
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Excessive demand on health services due to congenital heart condition
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Projected cost of medical care over five to ten years
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly assess submitted evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Dr. Hindle's opinion weighed over treating physician Dr. Belli without justification
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Medical reports from Dr. Hindle and Dr. Belli, financial assurance documents
Crimes.Application_Basis: Potential excessive demand on health services
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A person is inadmissible if their health condition might reasonably be expected to cause excessive demand on health or social services
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider financial plan and contradictory reliance on non-treating physician
Crimes.Outcome: Decision overturned, case remanded for reconsideration
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of placing excessive demand on Canadian health services
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's son has congenital heart disease deemed potentially costly for Canadian health services
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Financial assurances provided by applicant were not considered
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Contradictory medical opinions; lack of consideration of financial evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and inconsistent evaluation of medical and financial evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Reliance on incomplete medical analysis and disregard of financial assurances rendered decision unreasonable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to reconcile conflicting medical reports and disregard of financial evidence
